result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory A. Kimmins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and any sentence currently serving

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  

No contact with victim unless approved by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA and follow up.  

SAFE program intake, assessment and counseling.  

DNA sample.  

60/90/120 day probation review hearings.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory A. Kimmins

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on November 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Amy. 
Case called:  2:50 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF543, 22CF610, 22CF611.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Attorney Thomas Roley.  

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed; VRCW.  
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

22CF543>>
State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)
Count 2 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Repeater)
COURT GRANTS.  

22CF610>>
State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony)
COURT GRANTS. 

State moves to DISMISS Repeater enhancer on Count 2 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater); COURT GRANTS. 

22CF611>>
State moves to DISMISS Repeater enhancer on Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater); COURT GRANTS. 

PLEA:

22CF610: 
Count 2 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>NO CONTEST.  

22CF611: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony)>>NO CONTEST.  
Count 2 (Battery/Repeater/Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST. 
Count 3 (Disorderly Conduct/Repeater/Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on 22CF610/Count 2 and 22CF611/Count 1: SWH for 3 years probation; concurrent with each other and any sentence currently serving. 

COURT ORDERS on 22CF611/Count 2 and Count 3:  SWH for 2 years probation; concurrent with each other and any sentence currently serving.

CONDITIONS:  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up.  SAFE program intake, assessment and counseling.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  60 days MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations.  30 hours community service I/S to be used for rules violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharges.  60/90/120 day probation review hearings. 

Probation review hearings>> 11/11/22 at 1:15 p.m. 

Adj:  3:09 p.m.
Marathon County Victim Waiver of No Contact Bond Condition- R.L.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called: 2:02 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF543, 22CF610, 22CF611.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Thomas Roley. 

Date and time set for plea/status hearing. 
Atty Roley states they are waiting on offer from State; deft would like to resolve matters outside of trial. 

COURT sets plea/sentencing hearing for 9/28/22 at 2:45 p.m. 

Adj:  2:04 p.m.

10:46 AM 
INCLUDES 22CF543, 22CF610, 22CF611.
Clerk: Amy. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in custody with Atty Thomas Roley. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing; VRCW.  

ADA Coonen states offer is being conveyed today as this is ADA Zibolski's case. 
Atty Roley is requesting more time. 

COURT resets plea/sentencing hearing for 7/21/22 at 2:00 p.m. 

Adj:  10:47 a.m.

Clerk:  Micki. 
Case called: 9:50a.m.  
INCLUDES 22CF610 and 22CF611.

State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen for Natalie Zibolski. Defendant appears in person from the MCJ w/Attorney Thomas Roley. 
Date and time set for preliminary hearing; VRCW. 

Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 
Plea >> NOT GUILTY. 

Next Hearing >> CC: 6/1/22 at 8:05a.m.

Adj: 9:53a.m.
cc: Branch 4.

INCLUDES 22CF610 and 22CF611: No contact with victim(s): R.C.L. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Micki. 
Case called: 2:01p.m. 
INCLUDE 22CF610 and 22CF611

State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence.  Defendant appears in person in custody from the MCJ, with Attorney Greg Venturini.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved. 
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY on Misd. charges.

COURT ORDERS: $1,000.00 signature bond to cover both cases. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): R.C.L
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

Dates:
PH/JPTC: 5/23/22 at 10:40a.m. 
RH: 05/25/22 at 1:00P.M. Courtroom B.
PH:  05/31/22 at 9:40a.m. Courtroom B.

Branch 4.
